question_sentence: Controversial conservative talk radio host Rush Limbaugh died on Wednesday at age 70. He was awarded which prestigious prize?
On Thursday, NASA's rover, Perseverance, made atmospheric entry and touched down on which planet?
Tennis champion Rafael Nadal lost his bid for his 21st Grand Slam title, losing at the Australian Open to which athlete?
Intelligence operatives from which country have been accused of trying to steal or extort more than $1.2B?
FKA Twigs is being praised for speaking out about abuse allegations against which ex-boyfriend?
Which state is currently NOT facing power outages because of extreme winter weather?
At one point this week, what percent of the USA was covered in snow?
Charges were dismissed Tuesday against Amy Cooper, who called police on a Black man who was doing what in Central Park?
The child of which political figure made waves this week with her audition for ‘American Idol’?
Where was Donald Trump's real estate property that was demolished on Wednesday?
Which German state has mandated that medical-grade face masks be worn in public spaces rather than the fabric face coverings backed by the World Health Organization?
MEPs have urged the European Commission to take action after the last independent news radio station in which country lost its broadcasting licence?
What is the name of Nigel Farage’s new political party that was initially formed to oppose lockdown measures?
Experts are struggling to explain a dramatic drop in Covid cases that has seen reported new infections fall from around 100,000 a day in September to 11,000 now in which country?
What is the name of the princess allegedly being held hostage by her billionaire father, Dubai ruler Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid al Maktoum?
The UK’s former chief Brexit negotiator David Frost is replacing which cabinet minister as Boris Johnson’s ‘minister for Brexit Britain’?
The head of one of Germany’s most illustrious family dynasties has launched a lawsuit against his son over the sale of which castle?
Chancellor Rishi Sunak is reportedly planning to extend the stamp duty holiday for homebuyers beyond which original deadline?
The RAF launched a mission this week to make the population of which British Overseas Territory the first in the world to all be vaccinated against Covid-19 in one hit?
Dominic Cummings has been accused of awarding a lucrative government contract without tender to which research company run by ‘friends’?
Nigeria’s Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala was chosen to become the first woman and the first African to lead what international body?
evidence: Amid broad support, Okonjo-Iweala, an economist and former finance minister of Nigeria, will lead the World Trade Organization. The announcement comes following the withdrawal of South Korean trade minister Yoo Myung-hee from the running.

question_sentence: Which former athlete announced they’re donating $10 million to help open two new health clinics in North Carolina?
evidence: Michael Jordan made the commitment to donate $10 million to Novant Health to assist the opening of two new health clinics in New Hanover County, North Carolina. Jordan grew up in the nearby town of Wilmington, a place he said “holds a special place” in his heart.

question_sentence: Nancy Pelosi announced the formation of an independent commission to investigate the January 6th Capitol riots, comparing it to what other commission in history?
evidence: Though admittedly a much different time and event, Pelosi announced the plans to form a “9/11-type” commission that would investigate the January 6th Capitol riot. The 9/11 Commission was an official investigation and report that was published surrounding the September 11th terrorist attacks.

question_sentence: West African countries are on high alert after an Ebola outbreak in which country?
evidence: Authorities mobilized quickly to curtail an Ebola outbreak in a southeastern region of Guinea. The country’s National Security and Health Agency (ANSS) first announced seven cases, including three deaths.

question_sentence: After a judge’s ruling, which financial firm will not be able to recoup nearly $500 million worth of mistakenly transferred funds to various lenders?
evidence: Considered by some to be one of the “biggest blunders in banking history,” a judge ruled that Citibank will not be able to recoup the remaining $500 million of the whopping $900 million that was mistakenly wired to several lenders associated with the company Revlon. Citibank plans to appeal.

question_sentence: A member of Congress is personally suing former President Donald Trump and attorney Rudy Giuliani alleging that they conspired with far-right groups to incite the January 6th insurrection. To do so, he’s using a law that came about following which war in US history?
evidence: Mississippi Democratic Rep. Bennie Thompson is utilizing a federal statute established after the American Civil War to combat violent actions from the Ku Klux Klan. The law allows civil action to be brought against those that use “force, intimidation, or threat” to prevent anyone from upholding their duties of office.

question_sentence: What’s the so-called nickname of NASA’s latest rover to successfully land on the Martian surface?
evidence: The NASA rover Perseverance, affectionately referred to as “Percy,” finally touched down on Mars after making its months-long, 292.5 million-mile journey from Earth. “The mission itself personifies the human ideal of persevering toward the future and will help us prepare for human exploration of the Red Planet in the 2030s,” acting NASA Administrator Steve Jurczyk said.

question_sentence: Which US governor is facing intense scrutiny over the underreported coronavirus death toll in his state’s nursing homes at the beginning of the pandemic?
evidence: Governor Andrew Cuomo is under fire for his handling of the coronavirus pandemic at the beginning of the outbreak, specifically as it relates to official death counts at nursing homes being underreported by nearly 50%. Because of this, he’s now facing bipartisan calls for an investigation and limitations on his executive powers.

question_sentence: Iconic American singer Dolly Parton has politely declined to have what built in her name in Tennessee?
evidence: Dolly Parton has asked Tennessee state lawmakers to remove a bill that would have a statue of her likeness erected at the Tennessee Capitol. That statue would have faced the Ryman Auditorium, a venue she has come to think of as “something of a second home” throughout her career.

question_sentence: Which tennis player beat Serena Williams at the Australian Open, denying Williams the opportunity to tie the record of 24 major singles titles?
evidence: Japan’s Naomi Osaka routed Serena Williams in a singles semifinal at the Australian Open, preventing Williams from matching the record of 24 major singles titles, currently held by Australian Margaret Court.
